turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I know, I know, it's just...

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Looks like 'Rest Home' for this marriage.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Do you watch 'Dentonvale,' Janet?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I've caught it once or twice.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Of course!  D.T.V.'s most popular Hospital series featuring those perennial favorites, Cosmo and Nation McKinley. Neuro-specialists par excellence ...if you'll pardon my French. I recommend you send Brad to them for treatment!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I know he's boring but... Neuro-specialists!  That sounds pretty drastic.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: It's no use pussyfooting around, Janet -- we have to cut quick and deep.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Is it because I'm becoming too popular?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: On the contrary.  He wants to see your ratings soar.  He needs a woman of exceptional desirability.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Right!  An early start with Janet's debut on 'Good Morning Denton.' By the time we unveil Farley's 'Faith Factory' we will have earned our beauty sleep.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Can I just 'peep in' on Brad before I go home?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Home?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: When do I get to see Brad?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: After breakfast.  You're sounding tense, Janet.  Maybe I could give you a little massage?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: But...how?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: WELL FIRST YOU GO RIP RIP RIP THEN YOU GO SNIP SNIP SNIP THEN YOU WHIP IN A ZIP ZIP ZIP AN' YOU SPLIT IT UP TO THE HIP HIP HIP AN' AS YOU STRIP STRIP STRIP YOU QUIVER AND SHIVER FOR THAT SOFT CARESS AS YOU SLIP SLIP SLIP...INTO THAT LITTLE BLACK DRESS

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: SIN-I-FUL

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: LITTLE BLACK DRESS

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Dear old Bert's settled everything.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Jah -- you endorse his product -- He endorses your research.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: How did you come by this scenario?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: I am in Farley's employ -- and...  ...we're discussing a network deal.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Why Janet?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Everyone loves the girl next door, particularly Farley.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: So it seems.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: In my time they used to call me the Merlin of Berlin.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: They probably meant Irving and wanted you to swing.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Of course, Mrs. Majors -- Janet -- But I'm puzzled.  If she was so keen on getting him in here, why wouldn't she sign the contract?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: No it wasn't Janet -- exactly -- It was, in fact, your new sponsor.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: SPONSOR!!!

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Dentonvale has been sold.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: SOLD??!!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: With Fast Food Farley at the helm it'll be TV dinners from now on.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Farley is already a TV winner as we shall see.  Dentonvile will run forever now that his interest has embraced mental hygiene.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We're the experts.

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Who trusts experts?

turns.speaker: BERT
turns.text: Out of self comes selflessness.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Show yourself.  The real you. The secret you.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: In a way...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I detect a note of reticence. Are you, perhaps, one of those amongst us who feel this emotive form of presentation is overly manipulative?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Well, Betty, there are many ways that the spider may catch the fly...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Thank you so much, Judge Wright, for another wonderful interview.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Judge Wright?  Now, Betty? First name terms, surely!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, Oliver, you're so tolerant. Time for a coffee before you rush off?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Delighted, Betty -- That is if you don't mind being seen with an older man.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Why, Oliver, since Ralph and I separated maturity is something I look for in a man.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: A free thinker.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Everything's free there.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Macy Struthers -- God I must have been blind -- still, the weaker the man, the dumber the blonde.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Isn't that Brad and Janet Majors sitting down front?  What an ideal couple.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: McKinley?...McKinley?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Bert brought them over from Europe.  They had a very popular series together.  It's still rerun in a lot of countries.  You must have seen them in 'Dentonvale?'

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Conspiracy?  That sounds a little farfetched.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: It's happened before.  Remember Lieutenant Orpheus?  He disappeared into that Underworld series and never came back.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sounds like my husband.  He never came back either.  At least not after Flavors gave him a commercial break.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Ah yes.  Farley Flavors.  You know, I find it...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Conspiracy is right.  The Denton Dossier is...

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: ...closed?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I bet that Macy Struthers had a hand in this.  We'll probably be replaced by an hour of fashion tips!

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Now Betty, don't overreact.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Overreact!  You're the one with theories about conspirac...  Oliver?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Yes, Betty.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Are you spoken for this evening?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Clever of you to find this spot, Betty.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: It pays to know your way around, Oliver.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: A 'stately pleasure home' indeed.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh I adore Coleridge Taylor.  As a matter of fact...

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Look.  Look at that.  Bert Schnick can see.  Why...he's...dancing.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Yes.  Macabre, isn't it.  The blind leading the blind.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Did you /hear/ that, Oliver.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Yes, Betty.  But the false promise of a new dawn is usually followed by a most bloody sunset.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Care to indulge?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Indulge?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: In a little masquerade?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Betty, it's imperative we get Janet out of Flavors' fast fingers and Brad out of that hell-hole before they both disappear forever. If only I could place that name -- McKinley?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: He was a President.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: President?  Past Presidents! Betty, this is beginning to add up.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Really.  What'll I pin this on?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Faith, Betty.  But make sure it's your own.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR ENSLAVEMENT

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT ON THE PAVEMENT

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Oh.  Ah, I'm not calling at an inconvenient moment am I?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Not at all.  You have your life.  And I have mine.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Yeah, well.  Here, Betty.  I just came to give you this.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: I'll leave you young things to it.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Shove it, Ralph!

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: You too, Betty!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh, Oliver.  What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: No!  I don't know what Janet's next move will be...but you can be sure of one thing...it all starts here!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: That's us.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: I don't want to get up there.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: We've got to, Brad, everyone's watching.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: I'm not going, Janet.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: What are you trying to do?  Make Bert look like a fool?  He's made all the arrangements.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: But I don't need treadment.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: I'M LOOKING FOR LOVE

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I'M LOOKING FOR TRADE

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR COMPASSION

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR THE FASHION

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT TO BE FUNNY

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR THE MONEY

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: I'VE TOOK AS MUCH OF YOU AS ANY MAN CAN YOU'VE LOST YOUR HEART

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: YOU'VE LOST YOUR CAUSE

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: YOU LOST YOUR BABY WHEN YOU LOST YOUR BALLS YOU'VE LOST YOUR MIND, YOU'VE LOST YOUR GRIP SO SAY BYE-BYE

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: AN' YOU'RE A WEEPER AND A WAILER ALWAYS TREADING THE TOES OF THE GREAT GENERALLY SPREADING YOUR WEIGHT YOU'RE A SPITEFUL, HATEFUL ASININE CREATURE A PUPIL WITH NO SCRUPLES WHO KNEW BETTER THAN THE TEACHER

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: I'VE TOOK AS MUCH OF YOU AS ANY MAN CAN

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: YOU'VE LOST YOUR HEART

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: YOU'VE LOST YOUR CAUSE

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: YOU LOST YOUR BABY WHEN YOU LOST YOUR BALLS YOU'VE LOST YOUR MIND, YOU'VE LOST YOUR GRIP SO SAY BYE-BYE

turns.speaker: BRAD AND JANET
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR FOR EACH OTHER

turns.speaker: OLIVER AND BETTY
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR FOR THEIR LOVERS

turns.speaker: BRAD AND JANET
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR FOR IMPROVEMENT

turns.speaker: OLIVER AND BETTY
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR MOVEMENT

turns.speaker: BRAD AND JANET
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR FOR ENJOYMENT

turns.speaker: OLIVER AND BETTY
turns.text: SOME PEOPLE DO IT FOR FOR EMPLOYMENT

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: YOU'LL FIND A RAMBLING ROSE AND A PICKET FENCE

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: TENDERNESS AND INNOCENCE IN DENTON`

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Mental instability?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: He was adopted you know.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'd forgotten.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Well I hadn't.  I was worried about inherited craziness when they married.  I said to Janet 'What do we know of his parents?'

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What are you talking about? Danny Slepstrini is a chip off the old block.  I played 18 holes of golf with his father just last week.  And Hank says Danny's moved to New York.  To better himself.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: He moved all right!  When they found him with fifteen other naked men at the back of Wilson's Bakery.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh, Harry.  What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well...maybe I could wear my black leather brogues?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Too flashy...they'll clash with the new outfits.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: LIKE A VIRGIN WITH AN' URGIN' IN A SURGERY I'LL BE SWINGING -- I'LL BE BRINGING OUT THE NURSE IN ME

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: THE ART WILL START WHEN I PLAY MY PART AS THE HEALER WHO WILL STEAL YOUR HEART

turns.speaker: NEELY
turns.text: Mr.  Flavors -- may I have a moment of your time?

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: Sure thing.

turns.speaker: NEELY
turns.text: We've heard rumors that you're going to unveil more than just a new series tonight.  Is this true?

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: Absolutely correct.

turns.speaker: NEELY
turns.text: Could you tell us a little about it?

turns.speaker: FARLEY
turns.text: Let's just say that I'm putting sanity back on the national menu.

turns.speaker: NEELY
turns.text: And how does *'local girl'* Janet Majors fit into the scheme of things?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Could I do that later?

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: But they only think they're happy.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: That doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I won't be a party to this.  I want to see Brad.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: The question is, does Brad want to see you?  Quite frankly, he hates you.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: It's only one night, Janet. Let's not forget who we're doing this for?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Brad!  Oh, Brad.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: He's a lame dog, remember?  But even he wouldn't want to see you like this.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh my poor baby.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Oh.  Mom.  It's Brad.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: They call it a new look at an old favourite I copied it from the 'Window on the World' show.  The Far East meets the Mid-West!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: It's...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Just what the Doctor ordered.  I know.  Come on in, my favourite show's just started.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: What show?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Poor Brad.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Thank God he was born an orphan. It would have killed his parents.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You shouldn't have said that.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Your father doesn't like Mexicans.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I've just come to tell you how fabulous I am.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Janet!  Where's that lovely dress I made you?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Oh, Mac ran up this little crowd-pleaser.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You're practically naked!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I can't wear anything under it. That would spoil the line.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Hey!  What are you trying to do?  Get yourself committed?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I'm sorry, Officer.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Vance!  Vance Parker.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Janet.  Janet Majors.  It's just that Brad...my husband...is not... very well and...  I don't want to miss the next episode of Dentonvale.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Dentonvale...say, that's for...  I'm sorry to hear that, Janet.  Look I'm going to let you through, but keep it to yourself, otherwise...

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Thanks Officer Park...Vance.

turns.speaker: PARKER
turns.text: Don't worry, Janet.  Brad'll probably get just what he needs.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: BUT WITHOUT YOU AND ME, SIS  THE WORLD'D FALL TO PIECES  VENA CAVA WHO'S THE RAVER?

turns.speaker: TRIO
turns.text: OUR RAVING SAVIOUR THAT'S YOU!!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I NEED SOME

turns.speaker: TRIO
turns.text: YOUNG BLOOD

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I NEED SOME

turns.speaker: TRIO
turns.text: YOUNG BLOOD

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I NEED IT NOW I NEED SOME

turns.speaker: TRIO
turns.text: YOUNG BLOOD

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I NEED SOME

turns.speaker: TRIO
turns.text: YOUNG BLOOD

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: No!  He's never done that before.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Good!  Well there's still hope. Lots of hope.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Just one or two details.  Does he have any living relatives? Blood relatives?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: No...couldn't I do this later?

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I'm...happy.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: There are countless people in this world who believe they're happy.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Brad has deep feelings of hostility towards you.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's classical.  Almost a textbook case...

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I want to see Brad.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I understand your concern, but I feel it's time you started thinking of yourself.  Look at yourself.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Is it true they're all midgets with big heads?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Absolutely true.  Compared to all of them, you are perfection, flawless beauty.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You are the most desirable creature that ever walked.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: If only Brad could have found it within his heart to say these things to me.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: He will.  But it's up to you to reawaken his feelings.  You've got to be fabulous, look, think and appear fabulous.  And Farley's given you that chance.  You can use the Breakfast Show to knock Denton dead.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: Do you really think so?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: You've got a really tight team around you.  And everybody needs you!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: But what'll I do?  What'll I say?  What'll I wear?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: EVER SINCE I WAS A LITTLE BOY DRESSING UP HAS ALWAYS BEEN MY GREATEST JOY BUT WHEN IT'S TIME TO BE DISCREET THERE'S ONE THING YOU JUST CAN'T BEAT THAT'S A STRAPLESS, BACKLESS CLASSICAL LITTLE BLACK

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: . . .For his own good.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Of course.  He was in great danger of harming himself.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Brad!

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I'm sick of hearing about that lame dog.  I've got a lot going for me.  I'm going places.  I'm going to be someone.  I'm gonna win my way into the lives and hearts of people even if I have to kill to do it.  I'll make the pathetic little crumbs love me. I don't even know why I'm wasting my time here with you.  I should be with my people...

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: BRAD!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Arrest that man!  He's committed to our care.

turns.speaker: JANET
turns.text: I never signed the contract.  He's not going anywhere.

turns.speaker: TEACHER
turns.text: Let's hear the five 'F's' for today.  F for...

turns.speaker: KIDS
turns.text: Farley!

turns.speaker: TEACHER
turns.text: F for...

turns.speaker: KIDS
turns.text: Flavors!

turns.speaker: TEACHER
turns.text: F for...

turns.speaker: KIDS
turns.text: Fabulous!

turns.speaker: TEACHER
turns.text: F for...

turns.speaker: KIDS
turns.text: Fast!

turns.speaker: TEACHER
turns.text: F for...

turns.speaker: KIDS
turns.text: Foods!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Ah.  Mr. And Mrs. Majors.  How wonderful to see you.  I am Dr. Cosmo McKinley and this is my sister, and colleague, Nation McKinley.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: We understand you've been going through a rather trying time.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Our speciality.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I can't wait to begin on him. Really, Bert, I don't know what we'd do without you!

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: HE!!??  How dare this person take advantage of my weakness.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: I don't think he intends to go that far.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Our field.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: What does he know about it?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: It's you we're concerned about, Janet.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Yes how are you, Janet?  Are you happy?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: That's an extremely negative response.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Yes, Janet.  Leave the crying to Brad.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: This is the nerve center of operations, Janet.  You must stay here tonight.  That way we can all be here when Mr. Sun paints us a new day with his golden brush.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: And you can 'peep in' on Brad in the morning.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: I FEEL THE HEAT FROM YOUR SKIN AND THE STUBBLE ON YOUR CHIN YOU'RE NO GOOD

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: YOU'RE NO GOOD

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: YOU'VE GOT DIRT ON YOUR HANDS AND EVERYBODY UNDERSTANDS YOU'RE NO GOOD

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: YOU'RE NO GOOD

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: WHAT A JOKE...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: WHAT A JOKE...

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: YOU FEL LIKE CHOKING YOU PLAY FOR BROKE...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: YOU PLAY FOR BROKE...

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: HE LEAVES YOU SMOKING...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: OH ROMANCE IS NOT A CHILDREN'S GAME...

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: YOU KEEP GOING BACK IT'S DRIVING YOU INSANE

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: THAT MINIMAL

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: CRIMINAL

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: CRIMINAL

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: SIN-I-FUL

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: This could be worse than the old series.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: In the old series we didn't have a convertible.

turns.speaker: MACY
turns.text: Hi!  Macy Struthers -- co-host on the F. F. show.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Ah, Macy.  Why don't you help Janet freshen up before rehearsal.

turns.speaker: MACY
turns.text: Surely.

turns.speaker: MACY
turns.text: So all in all it's going to be an exciting new series for us...

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: ...and an attractive financial prospect for Denton.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: THIS COULD BE THE START OF A WHOLE NEW CAREER HERE

turns.speaker: MACY
turns.text: LIKE A DEEP PLUM LIPSTICK AND SOME THERAPEUTICS

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: THIS COULD TAKE US TO A TOWN THAT'S NOWHERE NEAR HERE

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: And none of them worked?

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: And we also know how you feel, we're not strangers to confusion.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: We're not confused.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: Isn't she lovely?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Mommy and Daddy love you, Baby.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: She walks in beauty...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: We love you, Baby.

turns.speaker: NATION
turns.text: We all love Janet...Who do we love?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nice technique there...  ...Cammi.

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: It's all in the wrist.  You know, you look really familiar. You from around here? Where'd you go to high school?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, we're from San Diego. Why?

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: I don't know. You just seem really familiar to me. Never mind. Enjoy your meals.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Hang on. Did you ever know a Derek Sommersby?

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: Doctor Derek Sommersby? You mean from "One Life to Live"?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You don't think I fuck you, bitch? I'll fuck you.

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: I'm a bad girl. I'm a bad girl.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You picked him up and you fucked him, didn't you, bitch?

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: I picked him up and I fucked him. I'm a bad girl.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: And you liked fucking him, didn't you, you fat little whore?

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: I liked it when you caught me fucking him.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: The fuck was that?

turns.speaker: CAMMI
turns.text: The wallet! He took Derek's wallet!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't bother him with that. We got to get going.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: It'll just take a second.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's Christine.  Hey you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: You guys having fun?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Yeah. All twenty minutes so far have been a blast.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Good. That's good.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: So what's up?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Just seeing how you're doing. And, um, Mom and I were starting to look over the seating charts again, and we're wondering if you wanted Tony Levin to sit next to the Feldmans, or should he be at one of the singles tables?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Really? Because I don't know, I was thinking that --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, then put him at the singles table.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: The problem with that is that then there's one extra --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Then put him with the Feldmans. Whatever you and your Mom decide is fine with me.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Don't dismiss me. I'm trying to include you in this decision. He's your friend.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I didn't dismiss you. I told you what I thought, but it didn't seem to matter, so you decide. Besides, this is supposed to be my time with Miles. I hope you're not going to call every five minutes.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I'm not going to call every five minutes, but this is important.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Honey, I'm just saying you know I need a little space before the wedding. Isn't that the point of this? Isn't that what we talked about with Dr. Gertler?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Why are you being so defensive?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I don't know, Christine. Perhaps it's because I feel attacked.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: I ask you one simple question, and suddenly I'm attacking you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Listen. I'll call you when we get there, and we can talk about it then, okay?

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: CHRISTINE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Miles.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Hey, Evelyn, it's your favorite client.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: How's the trip?

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Good, good. Drinking some good wines and kicking back, you know. So what's happening? Still no word?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: Actually there is word. I spoke to Keith Kurtzman this morning.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: And... they're passing. Conundrum's passing. He said they really liked it. They really wanted to do it, but they just couldn't figure out how to market it. He said it was a tough call.

turns.speaker: MILES
turns.text: Huh.

turns.speaker: EVELYN
turns.text: I'm sorry, Miles.  So I don't know where that leaves us. I'm not sure how much more mileage I can get out of continuing to submit it. I think it's one of those unfortunate cases in the business right now -- a fabulous book with no home. The whole industry's gotten gutless. It's not about the quality of the books. It's about the marketing.
